title: 美國胡佛研究所：香港人在地產商准許的商場唱港獨國歌是笑話

replies.msg:
https://www.miamiherald.com/opinion/op-ed/article235261012.html?fbclid=IwAR1r7X2ui01FTFZM7SOC3llqG9jSr3BDT0m68dORjYTyWCjZhU-VrjmrMeU

陳雲：
香港美學與音樂品味之衰敗，由美國評論家講出。美國的胡佛研究所嘲笑香港人在地產商准許的商場唱港獨國歌。那些字: Pristine, sanitized 就是嘲笑香港人的中產潔癖。懂得英文幽默的香港人，讀了會無地自容。
之前陳雲已經叫大家不要自我陶醉，因為那首不是好歌，而且商場根本是陷阱，泛民左膠當我是仇人，現在美國的頂級研究所的評論出來了，大家服了吧。

Markos Kounalakis丨Hoover Institution

//
"Thank the shopping mall.
In neighborhood after neighborhood, the mall has become the center of protest activity. In mall gallerias, chanting protesters no longer need yellow umbrellas to protect themselves from torrential rains and water cannons. Balconies are full of indoor dissenters who doff their gas masks in that last haven of consumer promise and pristine pacifism — the mall, with its food court, luxury goods shop, anchor department store, Huawei phone outlet and teen boutique.
Thank heaven for privatized, sanitized, and profit-protected capitalism. The mall may be the last refuge of democracy overseas — and maybe even here at home."
//
推

人哋原文係讚香港同係商場既抗議喎喎
又曲解人哋
好撚無恥


[black]Hong Kongers are reviving what Americans long took for granted and that we are slowly watching decay.[/black] The mall is the last physical forum in this country for broad and informal civic assembly and engagement across our diverse populace. It’s a place where we collect petition signatures and register voters. Some of this activity has moved to massive regional Walmart and Target-anchored power centers, conveniently, if soullessly, located off freeway exits. These places may provide inexpensive goods but are not generally known to inspire political flash mobs.

However, the malls that once promoted suburban American congregation have evolved overseas to become hothouses for urban political demonstrations. Witness Hong Kong.⋯⋯

In the ancient world, it was said that if the Coliseum fell, so, too, Rome. Today, as go malls, so, too, Hong Kong.

Read more here: https://www.miamiherald.com/opinion/op-ed/article235261012.html?fbclid=IwAR1r7X2ui01FTFZM7SOC3llqG9jSr3BDT0m68dORjYTyWCjZhU-VrjmrMeU#storylink=cpy

此回覆已被刪除

其實呢篇文章批評嘅唔單止係香港人喺商場唱歌，而家總括地批評地產霸權形成出嘅商場代替昔日嘅市集。作者用古代希臘嘅 agora （阿哥拉）作為比喻，慨嘆今日嘅商場根本上真係一個營商嘅地方，冇阿哥拉嘅百花齊放風格，唔容許民眾聚集。
古代嘅阿哥拉同等一個可以作為市集嘅祠堂，係民眾任何時間都可以聚集嘅地方。相反而家嘅商場，就係一個淨化嘅商業場所，民眾聚集都只不過係為購物消遣，無靈魂。呢一篇文章寫得非常之好，直接踢爆地產霸權嘅後患。

Credit:江燿堃 (facebook留言)

Some of this activity has moved to massive regional Walmart and Target-anchored power centers, conveniently, if soullessly, located off freeway exits. 識得港式幽默既就知連登仔屌陳雲未食藥/食左藥既意思就係: 痴線佬早D收皮.

淨係quote人哋其中一段出嚟斷章取義

之前一路都有人講過商場佔用公用空間，根本商場行動就係將本來屬於我哋嘅社區公共空間拎返嚟，係唔影響主線任務嘅情況下商場唱K大會呢個支線任務根本就應該要晚晚做，多人叫口號同唱國歌之餘，又可以broadcast我哋嘅訴求同概念畀所謂政治中立嘅人聽，行動前夕又可以用嚟叫人記得參加，仲有冷氣，根本就係低成本嘅宣傳手法

不如話係迷雲黨因為願榮光歸香港唔係城邦派作嘅，所以無所不用其極咁踩首歌

人哋原文係讚香港同係商場既抗議喎喎
又曲解人哋
好撚無恥


[black]Hong Kongers are reviving what Americans long took for granted and that we are slowly watching decay.[/black] The mall is the last physical forum in this country for broad and informal civic assembly and engagement across our diverse populace. It’s a place where we collect petition signatures and register voters. Some of this activity has moved to massive regional Walmart and Target-anchored power centers, conveniently, if soullessly, located off freeway exits. These places may provide inexpensive goods but are not generally known to inspire political flash mobs.

However, the malls that once promoted suburban American congregation have evolved overseas to become hothouses for urban political demonstrations. Witness Hong Kong.⋯⋯

In the ancient world, it was said that if the Coliseum fell, so, too, Rome. Today, as go malls, so, too, Hong Kong.

Read more here: https://www.miamiherald.com/opinion/op-ed/article235261012.html?fbclid=IwAR1r7X2ui01FTFZM7SOC3llqG9jSr3BDT0m68dORjYTyWCjZhU-VrjmrMeU#storylink=cpy
